text: A'ja Riyadh Wilson (born August 8, 1996) is an American basketball player. She plays for the Las Vegas Aces, a team in the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA). Wilson played for the South Carolina Gamecocks when she was in college. She helped the Gamecocks win the NCAA Women's Basketball Championship in 2017. She has scored more points than any other South Carolina women's basketball player. In 2018, she was the best player in women's college basketball. In 2018, Wilson joined the Las Vegas Aces. She was the first pick in the 2018 WNBA Draft. In the 2020 Summer Olympics, Wilson won a gold medal for women's basketball. She helped the Aces win the 2022 WNBA Championship. == References == Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:African- American writers Category:African-American basketball players Category:American basketball players Category:Medalists at the 2020 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 2024 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:People from Columbia, South Carolina Category:People with dyslexia Category:Podcasters Category:Power forwards Category:Women's basketball players Category:Writers from South Carolina
title: A'ja Wilson
